intro: Lechea leggettii var. ramosissima, commonly known as the ramose lechea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces elliptical, blue to purple berries that are typically eaten by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
